skillTree.localised_description: As one of the swiftest of airborne vessels, the Skycutter allows an Asur fleet to maintain aerial superiority over the battlefield.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: The eldest, most powerful Dragons can destroy entire units with a molten blast of their white-hot breath.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: The High Elves possess a natural skill that far outstrips the prowess of ordinary mortals.
The Trickster God knows all manner of ploys and ruses that can be used to counter missile attacks.
Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who cross the Sea Lord of Ulthuan rarely survive unscathed, if at all.

skillTree.localised_description: In one moment, the still morning fog; in the next, Asur regiments charging forth, clouds of whistling death falling ahead of them.

skillTree.localised_description: What other Asur deem excessive, Aislinn considers being thorough.

skillTree.localised_description: The first strike decides all. On the Sea Lord's signal, the sea claims what it is owed.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Leave nothing alive. Prisoners of war are nothing but dead weight."

effects.description: Replenishes 10% campaign movement range after winning a battle

skillTree.localised_description: As the Lord of the Sea, Mathlann is patron to sailors and explorers; he is prayed to by Elves about to embark on a voyage or seeking new lands.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for Gate Guard and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Gate Guard and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Mathlann has marked Aislinn as his herald, for purposes as inscrutable as the Lord of the Deeps himself.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Oceanids, Sea Elementals, Merwyrm and Ship's Company units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +10 for Oceanids, Sea Elementals, Merwyrm and Ship's Company units
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 20% when fighting at sea
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: In contrast to the enemyâ€™s savagery and blind bloodlust, Aislinn commands fear through a measured, contemptuous application of force.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can never have its Melee Attack reduced during battle.

skillTree.localised_description: Devout veneration of Mathlann can garner the god's favour, despite his uncaring nature.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 10% for Merwrym, Oceanids, Sea Elemental and Ship's Company units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: By the call of its mighty Sea Lords, the Asur fleet demonstrates why it is renowned as the greatest naval power in the world, its training superior to all others.

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.

skillTree.localised_description: The trust between two master sailors. Finubar the Seafarer knows the harsh realities of the sea and approves of Aislinn's methods.
The sword is the axis of the world and its power is absolute.
Panic and fear are things that happen to others.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dark Elves
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Dark Elves, Beastmen, Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
A technique performed with such speed and precision that it may appear to not have happened at all.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Turning an untrained bunch of regular citizens into effective fighting units requires a special kind of talent, and oodles of patience.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Every High Elf sailor has heard of Sea Lord Aislinn, and many dream of serving under his command.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

skillTree.localised_description: Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: Aislinnâ€™s host moves with unerring precision, advancing through arcane mists in perfect order, betraying not the perilous threshold between sea and shore.

items.colour_text: They say the quiet strength of the ocean is contained within this ancient relic of the deeps, along with a touch of its raging sentienceâ€¦

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The High Elf navy is the first line of defence against the enemies of Ulthuan, and Aislinn is its fulcrum.
